page.title: 02Smarden West - Population
page.content: In this area there are 123 houses in Smarden, 71 in Headcorn and 11 in Frittenden. There are 90 children & 438 adults of whom 77 are senior citizens. There is a nursing home in Headcorn with 16 residents. An estate of 38 mobile homes, an enclosed unit, stands beside the Maidstone-Tenterden road. It is beautifully maintained but no children or pets are allowed. The Oaks estate in Smarden is owned by Ashford Borough Council, apart from 1 house, bought by the tenant and now resold. There are 16 semi-detached houses & 4 flats. Almost all the rest of the housing in this area is detached with good sized gardens, and worth a high price. There are 9 oast houses, formerly used to dry hops, now well equipped homes, and 2 barns have also been converted to houses.
